name: Hotel La Taverna

reviews.text: Beachy vibe, ticked our boxes.
reviews.title: On the beach with pool and family interconnecting room - ticked all the boxes.

reviews.text: Most beach holidays we have walked 5-10 minutes to the beach, so to be on a beachside location was such a bonus for us. As a family with young child, interconnecting/family rooms were essential and the choices are limited; we need separate rooms or my daughter and husband will kill each other and we are on holiday after all. In this price range the choice is Besakih or La Taverna which are in a similar area and much the same price range. We stayed at La Taverna and visited Besakih – luckily, for us, the correct choice was made.
reviews.title: Great to be in the Park Suite!

reviews.text: Room – family room 24/25 – 1st floor, good sized balcony with table, large sofa, fridge and plenty of room for the inflatable crocodile and all the other beach paraphernalia. Into Master Bedroom, cupboard with safe and plenty of storage plus a hanging rail for your clothes, really wide but not long king’ish size bed, bedside lights, nice pebbly floor that doesn’t hurt your feet. Via two very small creaky twin doors into the bathroom – to the left a sink and toilet, to the right a sunken big bath with a shower above. Shower has new head and plenty of force behind it and placed so you do not soak the bathroom when you shower. Downside is there was no mirror in the bathroom and no-where to hang the towels. Upside is I asked for a mirror and within an hour a huge one was fitted above the sink – so folks, I think if you are unhappy here, just ask nicely and they sort it out. Ok, back to the room – via a single squeaky door to the 2nd bedroom, plenty of room here. Two single beds (also quite short, but let’s be honest the locals are not exactly tall!), drawer unit and hanging rail for clothes. Only downside is no reading lights in this room. 2nd bedroom also has a door to the patio/stairs which we kept locked (but useful if your have teenagers coming in later/different times). No ventilation in the bathroom, but the aircon dealt with any odours. Coils left on patio but not good quality and did not stay alight – Circle K next door sold them for pennies, so not complaining. Sound proofing from the floor above/below is superb – can’t hear a thing – we checked this out because downstairs had babies/little ones and we were concerned we may be disturbing them – not a hope.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast – they need to produce a menu at this point. The verbal menu is often lacking in most of the options, we only found out by mistake that pancakes were available as part of the included breakfast. Also ingredients not very consistent – one day the rice would come with an egg on top and the next day there would be no egg. Some days we were offered chicken rice but others only vegetarian rice suggested. The moral of the story is speak up, be very specific in what you want and you may be pleasantly surprised. Wish they pressed their own juice. I found the noodles to be greasy and tasteless, but am very fussy, so feel free to ignore this point.
reviews.title: La Taverna reconsidered

reviews.text: Grounds – lovely, beautiful and well kept. You are very near all your neighbours, but La Taverna seems to attract a similar mindset of client, so everyone is chilled. Plenty of gazebo’s to sit and read in.
reviews.title: 'Old Bali' feeling hotel on the beach

reviews.text: We stayed in La taverna for 3 nights in January and had booked a family room (two bedrooms).
reviews.title: bad family rooms

reviews.text: We arrived in the middle of the night to a hotel room that had no mosquito nets, the rooms were small and in the main bedroom there was nowhere to sit down except for the bed.
reviews.title: Authentic charm of Old Bali

reviews.text: The bathroom was situated between the two bedrooms, the door to get into the bathroom from either bedrooms were very small so during the 3 nights we kept on hiding our heads.
reviews.title: Maybe for a short stay only...

reviews.text: The rooms were in need of a make over and we were very disappointed by the rooms.
reviews.title: Nice hotel...but under renovation

reviews.text: The outside of the room had a terrace but under a very low cover and there were always tons of mosquitos hanging around so this was not an inviting place to sit down.
reviews.title: This place needs major work to bring it to decent standard

reviews.text: This hotel has real character. It may feel rather rustic to some, but I thoroughly enjoyed it.
reviews.title: la Taverna. Sanur, Bali

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Travelled alone and was a bit shocked at first viewing of my room, but grew to love it. Had a friendly liitle lizard that visited each night as i sat on the balcony reading. Room locking was very original! Everything very safe though ~ no problems and being a lone female felt very safe and happy here. Gardens. pool, restaurant , breakfast and beach all great.
reviews.title: Good, but not great

reviews.text: this place really is great ~especially gets to the 'hippy' , original traveller. think Mick Jagger floated upto the pool/bar in 60s!
reviews.title: Characterful and Old World-y

reviews.text: Could get wifi connections from local restaurants, could even lie on beach and use computer.
reviews.title: Infested with cockroaches

reviews.text: Not for those looking for luxurious, modern comforts or night life.
reviews.title: Had a very nice stay

reviews.text: We live in Bali and I always tell people to stay here first to relax after the long flight and ease into the slower pace of Bali. Cute rooms, ask for a room in the white buildings which have large private terraces/ porches.
reviews.title: Calm and comfortable Bali bungalows

reviews.text: I travelled with my husband and two kids. We had a family room, which consisted of two rooms separated by the bathroom. There was a large step in the kids bedroom, which might be a problem if you had small kids. There was also a large balcony which was great.
reviews.title: Fell in love with Hotel La Taverna!

reviews.text: The breakfasts were fantastic, by the pool overlooking the beach.
reviews.title: Good for what it is

reviews.text: My only complaint was the smell from the toliet was horrid. When I mentioned it to staff were were told they were fully booked and we couldn't change rooms.I moved a freshener from the bedroom to the bathroom, and we purchased rose scented fly spray from Circle K for the mossies wich also helped.
reviews.title: Surroundings - great, but not all rooms are equal.

reviews.text: We didn't eat dinner or lunch at the hotel. We ate many times at Bonsai Cafe and Bennos which are just nearby on the beach. Circle K is next door, the one on road side (not the beach) has an ATM.
reviews.title: This is expensive for what it is

description: La Taverna is a small privately owned hotel set within lush tropical gardens that open directly onto the golden sands of the Indian Ocean. La Taverna was one of Bali's first hotels and has over the years played host to artists, writers, musicians and a wide assortment of other colorful personalities. Its European owners have endeavored to maintain the spirit of old Bali, whilst also providing a relaxed, informal environment with emphasis on the personal.
